com.thekeirs.games.engine

Class GameObjectManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thekeirs.games.engine.GameObjectManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameView.IGameLogicService, GameView.IRedrawService, IMessageClient

    public final class GameObjectManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMessageClient, GameView.IRedrawService, GameView.IGameLogicService

    The central class of the game engine, responsible for keeping track of all the game objects helping them interact with the Android system.

    One instance of this class is created by the main game Activity and provided to the GameView at startup time.

                         android.content.res.Resources res)

        Parameters:
        mbus - MessageBus for passing messages between game objects and infrastructure
        res - pointer to the resources for this Activity so we can make them accesible to things that need them, in particular Sprite and BackgroundImageScene

        Parameters:

      • getResources

        public android.content.res.Resources getResources()
        Returns the cached resources object.
        Returns:
        the resources associated with the Activity that this game is running with.

      • addObject

        public void addObject(GameObject obj)
        Adds a GameObject or a subclass into the list of objects being managed.

        Objects in this list will have their update() and draw() routines called at regular intervals, and will receive UI events (taps, swipes) that are within their boundary.

        Parameters:
        obj - a GameObject or derived class to manage

      • getObjectByName

        public GameObject getObjectByName(java.lang.String name)
        Look up the first object that was registered with name name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the object to search for
        Returns:
        the object, if one was found; otherwise null.

      • getObjectsMatching

        public java.util.List<GameObject> getObjectsMatching(java.lang.String prefix)
        Return a list of all game objects whose names start with the given prefix.

        For example, if you register game objects named orc1, orc2, orc3 then you could get a list of these objects by calling with prefix = "orc".

        Parameters:
        prefix - the string to match against the object names.
        Returns:
        a List containing zero or more game objects.

      • setScene

        public void setScene(Scene scene)
        Set the scene to be used as a background starting on the next draw() cycle.

        If you want the background to just be a solid color, pass in an instance of SolidColorScene. If you want the background to be an image, pass in an instance of BackgroundImageScene.

        Parameters:
        scene - a subclass of Scene of the desired type

      • setWorldScreenSize

        public void setWorldScreenSize(float width,
                               float height)
        Sets the width and height of the game world in arbitrary units.

        This method should be called once at the start of a level to set the desired size of the world for that level. Changing the world size after the level is running has undefined behavior.

        If you don't call this method, the default will be whatever size was configured by the previous level, or 1600x900 if it was never called. 1600x900 is a good choice if you don't have a reason to do otherwise.

        Parameters:
        width - width of the world in units
        height - height of the world in units
